dt: {bc}a showy tuft or process on the head of an animal and especially a bird {dx}see {dxt|bird|bird|illustration}{/dx}
{bc}the plume or identifying emblem worn on a knight's helmet
{bc}a heraldic device depicted above the escutcheon {dx_def}see {dxt|escutcheon||1}{/dx_def} but not upon a helmet
{bc}a ridge or prominence on a part of an animal body
{bc}something suggesting a crest especially in being an upper prominence, edge, or limit: such as
{bc}the top line of a mountain or hill
{bc}a high point of an action or process and especially of one that is rhythmic

et: Middle English {it}creste{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}crista{/it}; probably akin to Latin {it}crinis{/it} hair
shortdef: a showy tuft or process on the head of an animal and especially a bird
the plume or identifying emblem worn on a knight's helmet; also : the top of a helmet
a heraldic representation of the crest
to furnish with a crest; also : crown

dt: {bc}the ridge of one of the folds forming the neural tube that gives rise to the spinal ganglia and various structures of the autonomic nervous system

shortdef: the ridge of one of the folds forming the neural tube that gives rise to the spinal ganglia and various structures of the autonomic nervous system

dt: wilderness recreational trail authorized in 1968 and extending 2650 miles (4264 kilometers) along the crests of the Sierra Nevada and Cascade ranges from the border with Mexico through California, Oregon, and Washington to the border with Canada and connecting seven national parks—Sequoia, Kings Canyon, Yosemite, Lassen Volcanic, Crater Lake, Mount Rainier, and North Cascades

shortdef: wilderness recreational trail authorized in 1968 and extending 2650 miles (4264 kilometers) along the crests of the Sierra Nevada and Cascade ranges from the border with Mexico through California, Oregon, and Washington to the border with Canada and connecting seven national parks—Sequoia, Kings Canyon, Yosemite, Lassen Volcanic, Crater Lake, Mount Rainier, and North Cascades

dt: mountains in north central New Mexico east of Albuquerque
